lines.text: Get your stinking hands off me, you damn dirty human!
Can't we all just get along?
[Prying open Leo's mouth and looking down his throat, as though looking for a soul]
Is there a soul in there?
Everything in the human culture takes place below the waist!
The young ones make great pets. Just make sure you get rid of them before they mature. Believe me, the last thing you want is a human teenager running around your house.
Never send a monkey to do a man's job.
Our apes couldn't talk.
Maybe they chose not to... given the way you treated them.
Stop it! Who told you, you could throw stones at humans?
My father
Did he ?He's wrong very wrong. You can tell him for me I said so.
Human lover!
Apes in cages... right!
[to Leo in regarding Earth]
I'd like to see your world.
I know. But they'd probably pry you and poke you and throw you in a cage too.

[smiles]
You'd protect me.
[Leo smiles]
[Leo notices the human mark on Ari's hand]
I can't go home either now. So, maybe we're not so different.
No, we're very different.
[Ari looks at him sadly]
You care about everybody, but yourself.
Monkeys are further down the evolutionary ladder,
[groaning]
just above humans!

[referring to cuffs]
No, no, no, I don't need those anymore.
Says who?
Says them! They tried to KILL me! Like I was nothing but a - miserable...
Human?
How many times do I have to tell you? Wear you gloves when you handle humans!

[looking at captured humans]
Are you trying to put me out of business? These are the skankiest, scabbiest, scuzziest humans I've ever seen.
Damn them!
I will stop him, father.
Damn them... damn them all to hell!
The smarter we get, the more dangerous we become.
Apes are afraid of water. They can't swim.
We drown!
That is why every day we pray for rain.

[emerging from his hiding place]
Oh! It's over already? I was *just* about to make my move...
How did the apes get this way?
What other way would they be?
They would be begging me for a treat right now.
Get me the spaceman!
What tribe are you from?
United States Air Force, and I'm going back.
Shut up! That goes for all species.
You know one day they'll tell a story about a human who came from the stars and changed our world. Some will say it was just a fairy tale, but, it was never real. But I'll know.
They all want to see this human who defies the apes.
Extremism in defense of apes is no vice.
[When telling the human tribes to run away while they can]
Look, you gotta make your people understand, it's over there's no help coming.
You came.
[When confronting each other on the battle field]
My fight is with Thade, not you.
Then your fight, is with me.
It's disgusting the way we treat humans.
Time to explain evolution to the monkeys.
I'm going to get my chimp.
What? Was the Homo sapien mean to you again? We all know its just rocket envy, don't we?
Ever consider an actual boyfriend?
You mean do I enjoy being miserable? No thanks, I'll stick with my chimps.
[while holding a gun on Limbo]
Play dead.
Senator Nado, good evening!
[Mutters]
My dear, you look lovely!
Thank you, but I'm having a bad hair day.

[about humans]
I warn you their ingenuity goes hand in hand with their cruelty. No creature is as devious, as violent. You must find this human quickly! Don't let him get to Calima!
We're in control now! We're the 800 pound gorilla!

[after being cuffed by cuffs used for humans]
Ow! These things hurt!

[blocking Limbo]
You kill him, and you'll only lower yourself to his level.
Exactly!
Hm, I knew it, you're sensitive. An uncommon quality in a man.
[groans]

[referring to Calima]
Well, that's where my crew is so that's where we're going.
Doesn't he ever stop?
You're letting him go?
No, he rides with us.
Wha? Wha?
[whining]
This is suicide!

[after others move away]
Only a human would think riding through an army encampment could work.
Y'know, I'd like to thank you, for opening my eyes to a brave new world of trade with the humans.
Yeah, no problem.
Farewell, Spaceman!

[immediately turns around to a group of children]
Now, who wants to buy some aspirin?

[to Ari about humans]
Next you'll be telling us that these beasts have a soul.
[first lines]

[to Pericles, who is panicking during a simulated space mission]
You lost.

[stops the simulation]
Again.

[Referring to the captured humans]
All right, get 'em out and get 'em clean! Chop chop!
I think it's fair to call this hostile territory.
